Definition

In this Article

public interface IComputeNodeOperationsPublic Interface IComputeNodeOperations

AddUserWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, String, ComputeNodeUser, ComputeNodeAddUserOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken) AddUserWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, String, ComputeNodeUser, ComputeNodeAddUserOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

Edit

Adds a user account to the specified compute node.

Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<ComputeNodeAddUserHeaders>> AddUserWithHttpMessagesAsync(string poolId, string nodeId, ComputeNodeUser user, ComputeNodeAddUserOptions computeNodeAddUserOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function AddUserWithHttpMessagesAsync(poolId As String, nodeId As String, user As ComputeNodeUser, computeNodeAddUserOptions As ComputeNodeAddUserOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of ComputeNodeAddUserHeaders))
Parameters
poolId
String String

The ID of the pool that contains the compute node.

nodeId
String String

The ID of the machine on which you want to create a user account.

user
ComputeNodeUser ComputeNodeUser

The user account to be created.

computeNodeAddUserOptions
ComputeNodeAddUserOptions ComputeNodeAddUserOptions

Additional parameters for the operation

customHeaders
Dictionary<String, List<String>> Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

The headers that will be added to request.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

The cancellation token.

Returns
Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<ComputeNodeAddUserHeaders>> Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of ComputeNodeAddUserHeaders))
Exceptions
BatchErrorException BatchErrorException

Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

Remarks

You can add a user account to a node only when it is in the idle or running state.

Edit

Gets the Remote Desktop Protocol file for the specified compute node.

Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse<Stream, ComputeNodeGetRemoteDesktopHeaders>> GetRemoteDesktopWithHttpMessagesAsync(string poolId, string nodeId, ComputeNodeGetRemoteDesktopOptions computeNodeGetRemoteDesktopOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function GetRemoteDesktopWithHttpMessagesAsync(poolId As String, nodeId As String, computeNodeGetRemoteDesktopOptions As ComputeNodeGetRemoteDesktopOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse(Of Stream, ComputeNodeGetRemoteDesktopHeaders))
Parameters
poolId
String String

The ID of the pool that contains the compute node.

nodeId
String String

The ID of the compute node for which you want to get the Remote Desktop Protocol file.

computeNodeGetRemoteDesktopOptions
ComputeNodeGetRemoteDesktopOptions ComputeNodeGetRemoteDesktopOptions

Additional parameters for the operation

customHeaders
Dictionary<String, List<String>> Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

The headers that will be added to request.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

The cancellation token.

Returns
Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse<Stream, ComputeNodeGetRemoteDesktopHeaders>> Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse(Of Stream, ComputeNodeGetRemoteDesktopHeaders))
Exceptions
BatchErrorException BatchErrorException

Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

Remarks

Before you can access a node by using the RDP file, you must create a user account on the node. This API can only be invoked on pools created with the cloud service configuration property.

Edit

Gets the settings required for remote login to a compute node.

Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse<ComputeNodeGetRemoteLoginSettingsResult, ComputeNodeGetRemoteLoginSettingsHeaders>> GetRemoteLoginSettingsWithHttpMessagesAsync(string poolId, string nodeId, ComputeNodeGetRemoteLoginSettingsOptions computeNodeGetRemoteLoginSettingsOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function GetRemoteLoginSettingsWithHttpMessagesAsync(poolId As String, nodeId As String, computeNodeGetRemoteLoginSettingsOptions As ComputeNodeGetRemoteLoginSettingsOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse(Of ComputeNodeGetRemoteLoginSettingsResult, ComputeNodeGetRemoteLoginSettingsHeaders))

poolId
String String

The ID of the pool that contains the compute node.

nodeId
String String

The ID of the compute node for which to obtain the remote login settings.

ComputeNodeGetRemoteLoginSettingsOptions ComputeNodeGetRemoteLoginSettingsOptions

cancellationToken

Returns

Exceptions
BatchErrorException BatchErrorException

Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

Remarks

Before you can remotely login to a node using the remote login settings, you must create a user account on the node. This API can be invoked only on pools created with the virtual machine configuration property.

Edit

Restarts the specified compute node.

Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<ComputeNodeRebootHeaders>> RebootWithHttpMessagesAsync(string poolId, string nodeId, ComputeNodeRebootOption? nodeRebootOption = null, ComputeNodeRebootOptions computeNodeRebootOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function RebootWithHttpMessagesAsync(poolId As String, nodeId As String, nodeRebootOption As ComputeNodeRebootOption? = Nothing, computeNodeRebootOptions As ComputeNodeRebootOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of ComputeNodeRebootHeaders))
Parameters
poolId
String String

The ID of the pool that contains the compute node.

nodeId
String String

The ID of the compute node that you want to restart.

nodeRebootOption
Nullable<ComputeNodeRebootOption> Nullable(Of ComputeNodeRebootOption)

When to reboot the compute node and what to do with currently running tasks. The default value is requeue. Possible values include: 'requeue', 'terminate', 'taskCompletion', 'retainedData'

computeNodeRebootOptions
ComputeNodeRebootOptions ComputeNodeRebootOptions

Additional parameters for the operation

customHeaders
Dictionary<String, List<String>> Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

The headers that will be added to request.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

The cancellation token.

Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

Remarks

You can restart a node only if it is in an idle or running state.

Edit

Reinstalls the operating system on the specified compute node.

Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<ComputeNodeReimageHeaders>> ReimageWithHttpMessagesAsync(string poolId, string nodeId, ComputeNodeReimageOption? nodeReimageOption = null, ComputeNodeReimageOptions computeNodeReimageOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function ReimageWithHttpMessagesAsync(poolId As String, nodeId As String, nodeReimageOption As ComputeNodeReimageOption? = Nothing, computeNodeReimageOptions As ComputeNodeReimageOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of ComputeNodeReimageHeaders))
Parameters
poolId
String String

The ID of the pool that contains the compute node.

nodeId
String String

The ID of the compute node that you want to restart.

nodeReimageOption
Nullable<ComputeNodeReimageOption> Nullable(Of ComputeNodeReimageOption)

When to reimage the compute node and what to do with currently running tasks. The default value is requeue. Possible values include: 'requeue', 'terminate', 'taskCompletion', 'retainedData'

computeNodeReimageOptions
ComputeNodeReimageOptions ComputeNodeReimageOptions

Additional parameters for the operation

customHeaders
Dictionary<String, List<String>> Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

The headers that will be added to request.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

The cancellation token.

Returns
Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<ComputeNodeReimageHeaders>> Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of ComputeNodeReimageHeaders))
Exceptions
BatchErrorException BatchErrorException

Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

Remarks

You can reinstall the operating system on a node only if it is in an idle or running state. This API can be invoked only on pools created with the cloud service configuration property.

UpdateUserWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, String, String, NodeUpdateUserParameter, ComputeNodeUpdateUserOptions, Dictionary<String, List<String>>, CancellationToken) UpdateUserWithHttpMessagesAsync(String, String, String, NodeUpdateUserParameter, ComputeNodeUpdateUserOptions, Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)), CancellationToken)

Edit

Updates the password or expiration time of a user account on the specified compute node.

Task<Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<ComputeNodeUpdateUserHeaders>> UpdateUserWithHttpMessagesAsync(string poolId, string nodeId, string userName, NodeUpdateUserParameter nodeUpdateUserParameter, ComputeNodeUpdateUserOptions computeNodeUpdateUserOptions = null, Dictionary<string, List<string>> customHeaders = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Function UpdateUserWithHttpMessagesAsync(poolId As String, nodeId As String, userName As String, nodeUpdateUserParameter As NodeUpdateUserParameter, computeNodeUpdateUserOptions As ComputeNodeUpdateUserOptions = Nothing, customHeaders As Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String)) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of ComputeNodeUpdateUserHeaders))
Parameters
poolId
String String

The ID of the pool that contains the compute node.

nodeId
String String

The ID of the machine on which you want to update a user account.

userName
String String

The name of the user account to update.

nodeUpdateUserParameter
NodeUpdateUserParameter NodeUpdateUserParameter

The parameters for the request.

computeNodeUpdateUserOptions
ComputeNodeUpdateUserOptions ComputeNodeUpdateUserOptions

Additional parameters for the operation

customHeaders
Dictionary<String, List<String>> Dictionary(Of String, List(Of String))

The headers that will be added to request.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

The cancellation token.

Returns
Task<Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse<ComputeNodeUpdateUserHeaders>> Task(Of Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationHeaderResponse(Of ComputeNodeUpdateUserHeaders))
Exceptions
BatchErrorException BatchErrorException

Thrown when the operation returned an invalid status code

Remarks

This operation replaces of all the updateable properties of the account. For example, if the expiryTime element is not specified, the current value is replaced with the default value, not left unmodified. You can update a user account on a node only when it is in the idle or running state.
